string.text: I found a flight recorder.
Ah, an excellent find! Perhaps we'll finally find the cause of these air raids in the marshes.
What can you tell me about Cold?
What can I say? He's earned quite a bit of respect as the current leader of our organization.
How did he earn that respect?

You see, there was some controversy regarding Lebedev, our former leader - who, by the way, I personally never met - and he didn't seem to take the opinions of the faction members into account during their crusade towards the CNPP. That mercenary certainly helped us out, but in the end, it just wasn't worth it. Those who remained at the base were unable to fight back against a resurgence made by the Renegades. The significance of our struggle in the swamps was reduced to zero... and the sacrifices on the way to the Chernobyl NPP, as well as the swamps, turned out to be in vain.
It seems like the faction's resentment towards their leader at that time was justified.

There's more to it... After our troops had returned, we had to start a long war to take everything back. We wouldn't be able to manage in day-to-day life without Cold. He received some help from unaffiliated stalkers and got in touch with people throughout the Garbage and the Cordon. Free stalkers helped us out, and having a charismatic leader certainly didn't hurt. Moreover, he's given an order to all fighters - without exceptions - not to leave here. We'll take any help, but we won't risk the lives of our guys.
Whoever Lebedev was and what he did, you aren't the same faction you used to be.
That's your opinion. Certainly has some value to it. Right now, we have no large-scale goals, except for maybe...er... Anyway, it's probably time we cut the storytelling and start the trading.
Trato hecho.
Whose pseudodog is that?
That's Buddy, the Doctor's dog. Doctor asked Cold to keep him safe, as he's started getting a little old.
Well, by the looks of it, you wouldn't say that he needs it.
Looks can be deceiving sometimes. This pet is a kind-hearted creature. Now, can I tell you something interesting about this kind of dog?
Adelante.
Pseudodogs don't actually descend from dogs at all, although they share the same ancient ancestor. They kind of originate from wolves - Duty learned that while researching them.
And how did you come to know this?

By virtue of my profession, I collect all sorts of stories. To the north, there's a place similar to our swamps called Zaton. I've heard there's an old crank that lives in the old barge, and apparently, he also has a pseudodog. Perhaps you can find out if it's true, if the distance doesn't bother you.
It's only the entire length of the Zone. Maybe I'll pop over there sometime.
I spoke to Noah - that "old crank" you mentioned earlier.
Oh, I completely forgot about that. So is it true - has he also tamed a pseudodog?
Sí. He calls her Lassie. She's got two puppies, and they haven't shown any kind of aggressive behaviour.

Puppies? Never thought you'd ever see that in the Zone. Well, thanks - now I know that there are more friendly pseudodogs breeding in the Zone. Here are some provisions for your future journeys... And, if you need it, you can have some information about a route between the Army Warehouses and the Red Forest. It's remained with us like an echo from the past.
Hey, why are you standing there?

If I want to stand, then that's my own business... Es una broma. I have to be in constant sight, since I'm a local guide. And please, don't stare at my equipment - it'll be easier for me that way. I can take you to a few places if you want, namely the observation outpost here in the swamp, as well as the pump station, the old church and the machine yard. I also offer trips to the rookie village in the Cordon, as well as to Agroprom and the Bar. All of it will cost you.
Can you repeat your routes?

These are the routes I take: the observation outpost for three hundred rubles, the pump station and the old church both for five hundred, the machine yard for eight hundred, the rookie village in the Cordon for fifteen hundred, Agroprom for two thousand and the Bar for four thousand.
I'd like to use your services.
Alright, where to?
The observation outpost. %c[d_orange][300 RU]
The pump station. %c[d_orange][500 RU]
The old church. %c[d_orange][500 RU]
The machine yard. %c[d_orange][800 RU]
The Rookie Village in the Cordon. %c[d_orange][1500 RU]
Agroprom. %c[d_orange][2000 RU]
The Bar. %c[d_orange][4000 RU]
He cambiado de opinion.

¿Yo? Well, I've been Clear Sky's guide for over seven years now. That said, during my earlier years, like 2011, I mostly stuck to the marshes, only rarely taking stalkers further. But that was a different time, before they found that damned mercenary in the reeds with a mouth full of swamp water. \nOur leaders didn't trust him - they had me blindfold him every time he wanted to enter or leave our base. And then within only a few weeks he'd somehow managed to convince them, along with most of our men, to charge into the power station. \nNeedless to say neither he nor much of our faction came back from that madness. All because of that fuckin' crazy merc.
You're talking about Scar?

The legendary, yes. More than his scar I remember his creepy eyes, though. That guy was seriously freaking me out. Professor Kalancha told us that he was somehow resistant to emissions. Not just that, he got stronger each time one hit him. Had his brain fried, too. Seems like he didn't survive the giant one at the CNPP party, at any rate. Serves him right.
Well, rest in pieces, I suppose.
Clear Sky is big on research, right?

We sure are. Like the Ecologists, we keep trying to understand the Zone better but we don't just observe. We prefer to use the knowledge we gain for practical applications. For example, shards of a Gravi artefact embedded in body armour significantly reduce its weight. The bloodsucker's coagulant can be implemented in a life support system that prevents blood loss during combat. And the resolving capacity of the Flesh's eye helped us develop advanced targeting systems. That's just some of the many ideas we've come up with.
Yes. ¿Qué es lo que quieres?
I've told you everything that I know.
I've heard you have information about the Zone.
Oh... I might have the information you seek, but I'll want you to do something in return.
Of course, what would you have me do?

The Zone has taken a heavy toll on me over the years, so I spend my final days here where it's quiet, but I would rather enjoy seeing my old friends once again.\nI fear Strelok and Guide may be dead, but I would very much like to speak with Fang and Ghost while there is still time. If you can find them and bring them here I would most appreciate your efforts.

¿Cuánto tiempo has vivido aquí? Fang and Ghost are legendary stalkers, but they're both long dead. Fang was killed by a mercenary named Scar in Army Warehouses, and Ghost was found underneath Yantar in Lab X-16 about a year later. ¿Ambos están muertos? ¿Estás seguro?
They're both dead? Are you sure? I just... Oh alright... What is it that you want to know?
Really, now you'll tell me so easily? I feel you are just wasting my time, old man.

Wait! Don't go... I just didn't expect them to finish badly. When Strelok last came to visit, he gave me a key and coordinates to a stash in Pripyat.\nHe hasn't visited in years so I don't suppose he's fared much better. He was saying something about the Monolith, I didn't understand much of it and I'm not too sure he did either. Toma, cógelo. One more thing... He spent a lot of time searching for clues of a conspiracy in underground labs, some kind of secret cover-up I believe. Perhaps you'll find your answers there.
Ya veo. Thanks, I appreciate your help.
Now go, leave an old man in peace.
Eres libre para irte. Information?... Or maybe you want to sell information?
I need medical assistance.
All right, let me perform basic treatment.
[continue...]
Very well, I am done. You should be good to go.
Let me see... No wounds. You show no signs of radiation sickness either. I think everything is in order; you are good to go.
Hm, yes?

¡Una cara nueva! La gente de por aquí me llama Bibliotecario. I'm the local bartender. I'll be glad to answer any questions you have. A veces publico ofertas de trabajo o escucho algunos rumores interesantes, así que vuelve a visitarnos a menudo.
Oye, stalker. ¿Cómo estás? ¿Qué necesitas?
Saludos, stalker. Can I be of assistance? Las buenas herramientas son difíciles de encontrar en la Zona, pero aún puedo reparar tu equipo y realizar pequeñas actualizaciones.
Tell me about yourself.

Well, I am Professor E.F. Kalancha. Alongside Lebedev and Suslov I was one of the founding members of Clear Sky. Unlike them, may they rest in peace, I stayed behind in the Hidden Base during their fateful raid on the Chernobyl NPP. I am the faction's head researcher. Most of the time I conduct experiments on artefacts, study mutant tissue samples and observe anomalies. Sometimes I cooperate with Novikov to find practical applications for the results of my work. Moreover, out of necessity I have also become the local medic. If you return injured from an excursion or, preferably, with some rare specimen in your bag, well, you know where to find me.
Así que ahora estoy a cargo aquí, defendiendo la ley local.

Many people think they understand what the Zone truly is. Sadly, they are all mistaken. Some think it is a manifestation of pure evil, others call it a miracle, while certain people can only think of all the riches they might obtain... They are all misguided by basic human prejudices. The Zone is an incomprehensible phenomenon when viewed through the prism of human perception. Far too early for us to even try. Both stalkers and the government act recklessly in their ignorance. We did as well, once, thinking our knowledge superior to everyone else's, and paid dearly for that.
What do you know about the Zone?

Young man, we have been studying the Zone for several years now but remain none the wiser. I can tell you that the Zone is definitely not a natural phenomenon but rather the result of... a futile endeavour devised by some overly ambitious people. We are unable to reverse its effects. The Zone cannot be destroyed, nor will it disappear of its own accord. Furthermore, experience taught us that any attempt to curb or contain it will have catastrophic consequences. Presently we, Clear Sky, believe that there is only one way to reconcile man with the Zone: coexistence.
That would be easier without emissions ravaging the area every few days. Speaking of which, what is causing them in the first place?

How can I best explain? Let's put it like this: any complicated system in nature, and that includes the Zone, automatically seeks equilibrium in the absence of destabilizing external factors. That was the case here a few years ago - the Zone was stable and there were no significant deviations from the norm… and now? Like you have said, devastating emissions regularly sweep across the Zone. The system became unstable, distorted… a glitch, of sorts. The Zone is spewing out emission after emission and pumping itself full of energy with each one, so much so that the readings on my sensors oscillate with unbelievable speed! Unfortunately, Lebedev and Suslov were unable to reverse this trend permanently, in spite of their tragic sacrifice. The most important lesson in all this is that this "glitch" is not a product of natural causes either. This is all human handiwork.

I'm the bartender. Sirvo bebidas, comida y mantengo la radio encendida. It's not an exciting job, but still preferable to being out in the field. He estado trabajando aquí durante varios años; estaba en el interior de los pantanos cuando se produjo la emisión, así que me quedé bien atrapado aquí. Headed south like most people tried to, but I was one of the few that didn't get picked off by bandits on the way. Busqué en esta base y me uní a Clear Sky. Era eso o morir en un charco en alguna parte. Pasé las primeras semanas como soldado repeliendo a los anarquistas de nuestros puestos de observación y luego conseguí el trabajo de nuevo camarero cuando Cold fue ascendido. Naturally, I accepted, as I'd rather be shooting drinks than bullets. ¡Pero basta de charla! ¿Qué tal uno bien frío?

Spore's the name. Me hice cargo de este empleo hace un año. Vine a la Zona buscando riquezas como todo el mundo y me encontré con un stalker llamado Nimble. Descubrimos que compartíamos muchos de los mismos talentos: ambos teníamos muchos contactos en el exterior, buenos en el tráfico de mercancías dentro y fuera de la Zona, y en la venta de información. Así que cuando ocurrió el resurgimiento del Monolito y los negocios se dirigieron al sur, los seguimos. Conseguí un buen trabajo aquí después de que Nimble me recomendara a Cold. He was a member of Clear Sky back in the day, y'know? 'Course, Nimble's gone back up to Zaton to help out at the Skadovsk, the madman, but he's left me with a nice little operation here. I now have access to an army-free smuggling route through the swamps, and Clear Sky gets first pick of everything I get my hands on. Pay Nimble a visit if you ever find yourself north of the Barrier. Even now, he's probably still peddling only the rarest weapons and armour to his fellow stalkers. For the right price, he'll set you up with some of the best damn gear in the Zone.

The name's Novikov, but some call me Grey. I'm the technician who keeps everything working, and the only person any good stalker goes to if their shooter starts jamming. Solía trabajar aquí hace mucho tiempo, hasta justo antes de que Cold se pusiera al mando. Cuando todo se fue a la mierda, busqué un lugar más verde y me contrataron los científicos cerca de Júpiter. Estuve allí unos cuantos años, hasta que un día escuché que de alguna manera estos chicos se recuperaron, y tan pronto como mi contrato terminó, volví. Me acogieron sin dudarlo; mis habilidades con un banco de trabajo y mis contactos con los científicos eran muy necesarios. Nos pusimos a trabajar con sus hombres para que pudiéramos seguir con nuestra vieja investigación. If you fancy the work, they're always looking for guides to the local anomalies. Talk to Spore about it if you're interested.

¿Por dónde empiezo? Por aquí me llaman Cold. I'm the leader of Clear Sky. Solía ser el que servía las bebidas aquí hace mucho tiempo hasta que le di ese honor a Bibliotecario una vez que nos enteramos de lo que le sucedió a Lebedev, Suslov y al resto de nuestros comandantes. After long and intense negotiations with the latest shipment of smuggled vodka, the local force decided that I was best suited for taking over the reins, and I've been holding on to them ever since.
Háblame de Clear Sky.
¿Qué es lo que quieres saber?
Wasn't the faction destroyed?

Casi, pero nos las arreglamos para salir adelante. Aunque la mayoría de nuestros hombres fueron aniquilados en la central nuclear, no todos lo fuimos. Un buen número todavía se encontraba en nuestros otros territorios, que más tarde quedaron aislados del resto de la Zona por anomalías posteriores a la emisión. Cuando se hizo obvio para aquellos que estaban en los pantanos en ese momento que estaban casi atrapados aquí sin una salida fácil, todo se fue al infierno. Honest stalkers became bandits overnight, whilst the rest tried to flee to our base, or live off the area's mutants. We took on a lot of men, and our food stores ensured their loyalty, and after a little while, it became obvious we'd need a new leader. I took on the burden and asked our Librarian to man the bar in my place; he'd earned quite a name for himself in the short time since he joined. After a few months of tit-for-tat raiding with the bandits, we managed to smoke most of them out, but that didn't stop the army from feeling like they needed to move in and finish the job. Incluso ahora, todavía tienen a ese pájaro suyo mirando las áreas que tomaron.
What's your current goal?

Thing is, we don't have a single goal. Poor Lebedev was an ambitious man. He thought we could discover all of the Zone's dirty little secrets and use the knowledge to tame or contain it. That didn't exactly pan out, though. Nowadays, we do basically the same things we used to do. We hunt mutants, collect artefacts and do some research on them. Every once in a while we recover some interesting documents from an old underground lab. But we don't engage in turf wars with other factions and we definitely don't plan another bold campaign into the heart of the Zone anytime soon. Unlike Duty we don't try to destroy it, and we don't want to open an amusement park here like the folks from Freedom either. For now, we coexist. Better keep a low profile, like the good ol' times before the final raid.
So, Clear Sky members basically do whatever they want now?

In a manner of speaking. We're all like-minded people with similar interests, so the guys pretty much keep to their tasks without me actively telling them what to do all the time. Been working out well for us so far.
Doctor, necesito asistencia médica.
Ya veo. Come here and I'll take a look at you.
¿Es grave?
Parece que necesitas que te curen. I can't remove any radiation, but I'll deal with the wounds.
No hay lesiones o radiación, parece. Everything's alright, lad.
Muy bien, doctor. Por favor, ayúdame.
Gracias por la ayuda.
One moment, please... Everything should be fine now. You're free to go.
Finally it's over, let's clean up this mess and then get some rest. Thanks for the help stalker.
Well shit, the boss croaked, I'm taking command. Thanks for the help stalker.
Watch out, somebody is coming that way! ...nevermind, it's not a bandit. Stalker, if you have any business here get it done quick, shit will go down soon.
Here we go! Everyone in position, they're coming!
If you go too far Clear Sky stalkers may think you're running away.
You ran away leaving Clear Sky to fend off the bandits alone.
Reach the pump station.
Talk with the commander of the guards.
Take the position of the fallen sniper.
Survive!
Report to the commander.
Return to Cold for the reward.
You better get moving stalker, soon here will be a mess.
Cold sent me to help against the bandits.
Great, we really need any help we can get. Our sniper got killed in the last attack, we need someone up there to pop some heads.
Ok, I'm going up.
Thanks for the warning, I'm out.
Sal de aquí, stalker.
On my way, just getting my stuff ready.
Well that's it for another day, your help was critical. Nos vemos por ahí.
Alright, bye.
I wanted to become the commander of the strike team, but not like this...
What a shame.
